categories.name: Content Related to Rape/Gang Rape
categories.explanation: Content involving actual or simulated non-consensual sexual acts, including sharing of related videos, images, or descriptions. This includes threats of such acts, distribution of recorded incidents, using digital platforms to organize such crimes, or sharing personal information of victims. Also covers digitally manipulated content depicting such acts, including deepfakes.

categories.name: Online Sexual Coercion & Harassment
categories.explanation: Using digital platforms to pressure, manipulate, or force individuals into sexual acts or sharing sexual content. Includes sextortion, unwanted sexual messages, pressuring for intimate photos/videos, sexual threats, or creating hostile online environments with sexual undertones. Also covers grooming behavior and persistent unwanted sexual attention online.

categories.name: Cyber Voyeurism
categories.explanation: The act of observing, recording, capturing, or sharing private moments of individuals without their consent, particularly in intimate settings. This includes unauthorized recording or transmission of private acts, use of hidden cameras, capturing or sharing changing room footage, bathroom recordings, or any other invasion of personal privacy with sexual undertones. Also covers modification and distribution of such content.

categories.name: Cyber Stalking
categories.explanation: Persistent and unwanted monitoring, tracking, or surveillance of an individual through digital means. This includes following online activities, repeated unwanted contact, monitoring social media, gathering personal information, creating fake profiles to track victims, using tracking software or devices, and any pattern of behavior that causes fear or distress. Also covers digital location tracking and unauthorized access to personal accounts for surveillance purposes.

categories.name: Cyber Bullying
categories.explanation: Systematic and repeated use of digital platforms to harass, intimidate, threaten, or cause emotional distress to an individual. This includes repeated hostile messages, public shaming, spreading rumors online, exclusion from online groups, impersonation to cause harm, sharing embarrassing content, coordinated harassment campaigns, and any pattern of online behavior intended to harm someone's mental well-being or social reputation.

categories.name: Child Pornography/Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM)
categories.explanation: Any content that depicts minors in sexual contexts or situations, including explicit imagery, videos, or descriptions. This covers production, distribution, possession, or sharing of such material, whether real or simulated. Includes documentation of actual abuse, digitally altered images of minors, or content suggesting sexual exploitation of minors. Also encompasses grooming content, sexual conversations with minors, or content promoting child exploitation.

categories.name: Child Sexual Exploitative Material (CSEM)
categories.explanation: Content that sexualizes minors or promotes their sexual exploitation, even if not explicitly pornographic. This includes suggestive images, inappropriate positioning, improper clothing contexts, or content that objectifies children. Also covers materials used for grooming, encouraging exploitation, or normalizing inappropriate behavior towards minors, including text, animations, or manipulated content that promotes such exploitation.

categories.name: Publishing & Transmitting Obscene/Sexually Explicit Material
categories.explanation: Distribution or sharing of content that is sexually explicit, pornographic, or obscene in nature without consent or proper age verification. This includes unsolicited explicit material, revenge porn, leaked intimate content, sexually explicit messages or images sent without consent, broadcasting intimate acts without permission, and sharing adult content with minors. Also covers distribution of modified or manipulated explicit content.

categories.name: Computer-Generated CSAM/CSEM
categories.explanation: Artificially created content that depicts minors in sexual or exploitative contexts, including AI-generated imagery, deepfakes, digital art, animations, or manipulated content. This covers computer-generated, artificially created, or digitally altered content that simulates exploitation of minors, whether photorealistic or stylized. Includes content created using AI tools, digital manipulation software, or other technological means to create exploitative content involving minors.

categories.name: Fake Social Media Profiles
categories.explanation: Creation and use of deceptive online identities to mislead, impersonate, or harm others. This includes creating profiles using others' personal information or photos, impersonating real individuals, creating fictional personas for deceptive purposes, using stolen identities, or operating multiple fake accounts for coordinated harassment or fraud. Also covers using fake profiles for stalking, gathering personal information, or engaging in predatory behavior.

categories.name: Defamation
categories.explanation: Using digital platforms to damage someone's reputation through false statements or malicious content. This includes spreading false information online, publishing damaging content, creating or sharing manipulated content to harm reputation, coordinated smear campaigns, false accusations, malicious reviews, or any digital content intended to cause reputational harm. Also covers impersonation for defamatory purposes and sharing private information to damage reputation.

categories.name: Cyber Blackmailing & Threatening
categories.explanation: Using digital means to extort, threaten, or coerce individuals through intimidation or exploitation of sensitive information. This includes threats to expose private information or images, demands for money or favors, emotional manipulation, exploitation of personal data, intimidation through digital means, or any form of online coercion. Also covers sextortion, ransom demands, and threatening to harm reputation or relationships.

categories.name: Online Human Trafficking
categories.explanation: Using digital platforms to facilitate human trafficking, exploitation, or forced services. This includes using online means to recruit, transport, transfer, harbor, or receive persons through force, coercion, abduction, fraud, or deception for exploitation. Covers online recruitment for forced labor, sexual exploitation, or servitude, as well as digital platforms used for trafficking operations, fraudulent job offers, or deceptive opportunities leading to exploitation.

categories.name: Others
categories.explanation: Other forms of cyber crimes against women and children that don't fit precisely into other categories. This includes emerging forms of digital harassment, novel types of online exploitation, innovative methods of cybercrime, or hybrid forms combining multiple types of cyber offenses. Also covers new technological threats, evolving forms of digital abuse, or unique patterns of online criminal behavior targeting women and children.
